author: thezim
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Get-Item .\powershell.exe | Format-List
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

The following contain values.

```none
InternalName:
OriginalFilename:
FileVersion:
FileDescription:
Product:
ProductVersion:
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Name           : powershell.exe
Length         : 78336
CreationTime   : 10/4/2017 5:03:40 PM
LastWriteTime  : 10/4/2017 5:03:40 PM
LastAccessTime : 10/4/2017 5:03:40 PM
Mode           : -a----
LinkType       :
Target         : {}
VersionInfo    : File:
                 C:\Development\Apps\PowerShell\powershell.exe
                 InternalName:
                 OriginalFilename:
                 FileVersion:
                 FileDescription:
                 Product:
                 ProductVersion:
                 Debug:            False
                 Patched:          False
                 PreRelease:       False
                 PrivateBuild:     False
                 SpecialBuild:     False
                 Language:
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.1.7601 S
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I believe this is due to dotnet.exe build doesn't insert those resource values.  Related https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2883

title: powershell.exe does not contain all VersionInfo properties.
